articles.title: Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs
articles.description:
Smithfield said it will absorb production in its other plants, with operations ending in August.

The post Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Smithfield's Springfield dry sausage plant will close operations in August 2023.
The closure will result in 190 job losses for local workers.
Production will be absorbed by other Smithfield plants, affecting local supply chains.

articles.title: What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future
articles.description:
"I anticipate being here. I hope so. Love my guys. Hell of a year playing with them."

The post What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Stefon Diggs expressed optimism about staying with the Patriots in a recent statement.
Diggs praised his teammates, highlighting a strong season together in 2023.
His commitment could influence the Patriots' strategy for the upcoming NFL season.

articles.title: Prosecutor who tried Brian Walshe for murder enters Norfolk DA race
articles.description:

summary: Prosecutor Greg Connor, known for the Brian Walshe murder trial, enters Norfolk DA race.
Connor emphasizes his extensive experience with Norfolk County communities and law enforcement.
His candidacy may influence local crime policies and community safety initiatives.

articles.title: World Cup plans at risk as Foxborough pushes for security funding
articles.description:
Town officials say they will withhold Gillette Stadium’s entertainment license unless organizers secure funding for police and safety operations.

The post World Cup plans at risk as Foxborough pushes for security funding appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Foxborough officials threaten to withhold Gillette Stadium's entertainment license over security funding issues.
Organizers must secure funding for police and safety operations ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
Failure to address funding could jeopardize major events and economic benefits for Boston residents.

articles.title: Marlborough hospital evacuated after ‘Code Black’ shutdown
articles.description:
The hospital transferred more than 70 patients as UMass Memorial’s Marlborough campus shut down inpatient care due to heat and water system failures.

The post Marlborough hospital evacuated after ‘Code Black’ shutdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Marlborough hospital evacuated over 70 patients due to heat and water system failures.
UMass Memorial's Marlborough campus ceased inpatient care following a 'Code Black' alert.
Local residents may face increased pressure on nearby hospitals for care.
